title: Wrong acceleration readings from IMU in rotors

content.raw:
After spending a significant amount of time debugging why our Inertial \+ Visual odometers don’t work, we have found out that the IMU readings in the X and Y direction of the linear acceleration are wrong. 

This can be reproduced extracting the ground truth velocity of the robot in the simulator, differentiating it, adding the gravity vector, and expressing the resultant quantity in the local reference frame of the robot. 

By simple inspection of the IMU signal, it can be seen that the readings for the linear acceleration in X and Y are an order of magnitude smaller of what they should be.

How do these critical bugs affect the qualification process that ends on the 3rd of January?

‌
